events.originalText: A former military aircraft crashed at an airshow at Shoreham Airport in southern England, killing eleven people.
events.subtitle: 2015 Shoreham Airshow crash
events.headline: Former military aircraft crashes at Shoreham Airport, killing eleven

events.originalText: A series of ethnic clashes between the Orma and Pokomo tribes of Kenya's Tana River District resulted in the deaths of at least 52 people.
events.subtitle: 2012–2013 Tana River District clashes
events.headline: Ethnic clashes in Kenya result in at least 52 deaths

events.originalText: A fire broke out on British Airtours Flight 28M, causing 55 deaths mostly due to smoke inhalation and bringing about changes to make aircraft evacuation more effective.
events.subtitle: 1985 Manchester Airport disaster
events.headline: Fire on British Airtours Flight 28M causes 55 deaths

events.originalText: The constitution of Singapore was amended to apportion seats to defeated opposition candidates in Parliament, which had hitherto entirely comprised members of the People's Action Party.
events.subtitle: Constitution of Singapore
events.headline: Singapore constitution amended to include defeated opposition candidates in Parliament

events.originalText: Ida Siekmann jumped from a window in her tenement building trying to flee to West Berlin, becoming the first person to die at the Berlin Wall.
events.subtitle: Ida Siekmann
events.headline: Ida Siekmann dies trying to flee to West Berlin

events.originalText: Ian Stephens, editor of The Statesman, defied British censorship to publish pictures of death and misery (example pictured) on Calcutta's streets, informing the world of the Bengal famine of 1943.
events.subtitle: Ian Stephens (editor)
events.headline: Editor defies censorship to publish Bengal famine pictures

events.originalText: First World War: German forces captured Rossignol (damaged buildings pictured) in Belgium, taking more than 3,800 French prisoners.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: German forces capture Rossignol in Belgium, taking 3,800 French prisoners

events.originalText: First World War: A squadron of the 4th Royal Irish Dragoon Guards attacked a German scout party, the first engagement of British forces on the Western Front.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: First British engagement on Western Front in First World War

events.originalText: Under the leadership of Henry Dunant and the International Committee of the Red Cross, twelve European states signed the First Geneva Convention, establishing rules for the protection of victims of armed conflict.
events.subtitle: Henry Dunant
events.headline: First Geneva Convention signed to protect victims of armed conflict

events.originalText: The yacht America won the Cup of One Hundred Sovereigns race, later renamed the America's Cup, near the Isle of Wight, England.
events.subtitle: America (yacht)
events.headline: Yacht America wins Cup of One Hundred Sovereigns race near Isle of Wight

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: Benedict Arnold used a ruse to convince the British that a much larger force was arriving, causing them to abandon the siege of Fort Stanwix (reconstructed fort pictured).
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Benedict Arnold's ruse causes British to abandon siege of Fort Stanwix

events.originalText: Queen Anne's War: A British attempt to attack Quebec failed when eight ships wrecked on the St. Lawrence River.
events.subtitle: Queen Anne's War
events.headline: British attempt to attack Quebec fails with eight ships wrecked

events.originalText: King Charles I raised the royal standard at Nottingham, marking the beginning of the First English Civil War.
events.subtitle: Charles I of England
events.headline: King Charles I raises royal standard, starting First English Civil War

events.originalText: The Vijayanagara Empire leased a small strip of land in present-day Chennai, the capital of the present-day Indian state of Tamil Nadu, to the East India Company.
events.subtitle: Vijayanagara Empire
events.headline: Vijayanagara Empire leases land in present-day Chennai to East India Company

events.originalText: Lancastrian forces under Henry Tudor, Earl of Richmond, defeated Yorkist forces under Richard III of England at the Battle of Bosworth Field, decisively ending the Wars of the Roses.
events.subtitle: House of Lancaster
events.headline: Lancastrians defeat Yorkists at Battle of Bosworth Field, ending Wars of the Roses
